alert.note: Alert for Brown (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 5:56PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTH CENTRAL BROWN AND WEST CENTRAL HIGHLAND COUNTIES THROUGH 630 PM EDT... At 556 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Lynchburg, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Hillsboro, Lynchburg, Russell, St. Martin and Danville in Highland County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
